detailsOfAchievement: Aneek, a theatre group with a difference, which was established on 28th October, 1988 is now running the 21st year of its glorious existence. Objective: Aneekâ€™s objective is to carry out a meaningful social discourse in the crucible of time past and the time present through Theatre, a living art that keeps moving with the times. During the last twenty years Aneek has successfully produced 12 full length plays, 11 short plays and 2 audio-plays, marked by its distinctive quality, which have received wide appreciation from the press and the public. Theatre in Education: For the last seven years Aneek has been organising Inter-School, Inter-College and Inter-University drama competition with the belief that if properly guided, students and youths will come out effectively to protect the interests of the society and the nation. Theatre can be used as an effective tool for the purpose. Institute of Theatre Education: Theatre, we all know is a matter of pride in this socio-cultural life. To impart scientific education on theatre to theatre workers we have established Aneek Institute of Theatre Education. In this field Aneek has mainly concentrated its activities on the socially backward communities, especially the scheduled tribes. Performances: Besides organising our own shows, Aneek regularly performs shows on invitation which includes, participation in the festivals organised by Department of Culture, Govt. of India, Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre, Sanget Natak Academy, Department of Culture, Govt.of West Bengal, Department of Youth Services, Govt of West Bengal and also various other organisations throughout the country. Aneek also participated in the International Theatre festivals in Dhaka, Jessore, Tangail and Chittagong in Bangladesh in the year 1999, 2000 and 2008 (twice). Awards and Laurels: For excellence in production and for developing human values and understanding Aneek has received awards like: International Awards â€“ 1. Lebedev Award of U.S.S.R government in 1990 for Best Production, Best Dramatist, Best Direction. 2. Nurun Nahar Samad Natya Padak of Bangladesh in the year 1999 for Best Production, Best Dramatist, Best Direction. State Awards â€“ 1. State Drama Academy Award â€“ 4 times in the years 1992 (Best Dramatist), 1994 (Best Stagecraft), 2000 (Best Direction) and 2004 (Best Actor). Other Awards â€“ 1. Sundaram Award (Best Dramatist) 2. Dishari Award (Best Director) 3. Drama Academy Award (Best Dramatist) 4. Jyotsnamakha Das Smarak Samman (Best Production, Best Actress) 5. Shalimar Award (Best Dramatist) 6. Abhineyo Award (Best Dramatist) Seminar and Research: Aneek regularly organises seminars as a part of its research projects on the cultural events of importance to educate and enlighten the theatre workers in particular, and culturally minded people in general. International Theatre Festivals: Aneek regularly organises theatre festivals to coordinate and establish common bonding with other theatre groups and the theatre-loving people of our country and abroad. The International Theatre festival â€“ Ganga Jamuna Natya Utsab will be celebrating a decade of its brilliant evolution. It has been recognised as one of importance in the cultural events of our country and has occupied its due place in the cultural calendar of our country.

detailsOfAchievement: ANGAN BELGHARIA-2003 has been a pioneer of social activities since 1987 whose objective is to produce and enact dramas with the help of young and energetic participant. The themes highlighted social evils and public enlighten caused thereby. The various other activities include arranging seminars, Festivals, Theatre Workshop, exhibitions and Training programs. ANGAN BELGHARIA-2003, have staged dramas at various well-known theatre halls like Sisir Mancha, Girish Mancha, Rabindra Sadan, Tapan Theatre, Sujata Sadan, Bijon Theatre and others. These dramas received tremendous success not only in Kolkata but also in villages. Even outside the state of West Bengal. Our productions have been much Appreciated by the media and public. We have staged the dramas like Jiban-Judhdho, Sovone Jonnya, Ingit, Panja, KabhiKankal, Dwija, Trisha, Ramdhanur-Khonje, Dwitiyo- Simanto, Tabuo-Sakal, 26th July. The organization is not meant for one hours play and that is why 21 (twenty one) full time workers (Artist) and 1 (one) Guru are busy with the work of the organization without any remuneration. The organization takes care of energetic young artists and guides them with properly. It is to mention here that they are planning to organize a seminar for energetic young artists in the coming year. It is sure that we will be able to stick to our objectives and avoid crass commercialization temptations. PRODUCTION AND PERFOMANCES Over the Year ANGAN BELGHARIA-2003 has produced a new play DWITTYO- SIMANTO and has been performing with its other theatre productions throughout the year. The troupe not only confined in the village areas but also performance in the district towns including Kolkata.

detailsOfAchievement: ANJIKA Centre for Manipuri Dance & Movement Therapy was established in 1995 under the guidance of MK Binodini Devi and Pandit N. Khelchandra Singh. It provides a complete education in the Manipuri dance form-one of the eastern Indiaâ€™s two great classical dance forms. It includes skill and the technique, the tradition and the responsibility and finally the sadhana and the fulfillment it brings. Through Anjika, Priti Patel is making a lifetime commitment to pass on to the new generations of dancers the comprehensive regine and techniques of training developed by the great Gurusâ€™ viz. Lt.Guru Bipin Singh and Lt.Ojha Th. Babu Singh, as well as the cull wisdom of acknowledged masters such as the Lt. Ojha Khetritombi Devi, Lt.Ojha Kelchandra Singh, Lt. Ojha Surchand Sharma and Lt. Ojha Kumar Maibi. As a professional Danseuse, Miss Patel is probably exceptional in the comprehensiveness of her approach; she has undergone training even in stage lighting; from the renowned designer Lt.Shri. Tapas Sen. Anjika has a Governing Body in Kolkata whose names are given in the Constitution of Board of Management. Beside we also have a Panel of Advisors in Imphal whose name are given below : 1. Ojha Samarendra Singh 2. Ayega Aribam Shyam Sharma 3. Makhonmoni Singh 4. Kishorjit Singh 5. Somi Roy Having received formal training in expressive Therapy at Lesley College, Boston, USA. Miss Patel has had long opportunity to apply her knowledge in her own work among children with celebral palsy. Her curriculum is based on a wonderful efficacy and relevance of Manipuri dance. With its gentle swaying rhythms and flowing movements, the Manipur dance form not only helps the disadvantaged child to gain mastery of his or her limbs, but to stimulate, absorb and uplift the spirit; build confidence and hope in a young minds imprisioned by disobedient bodies. AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF ANJIKA 1. To build an Institution catering to all the aspects of Manipuri Dance and Culture. 2. To run an integrated learning programme for the disabled using dance as Therapy. 3. To collect and record the works of existing eminent Gurus and thereby from a Research and an Archive Wing. 4. To facilitate the training in Manipur for students from other parts of India and abroad. 5. To conduct Workshops, Lecture Demonstrations and Seminars by renowned artists of other dance forms along with Manipuri to enable the students of Anjika as well as the other Institutions to get a complete training and appreciate the different dance styles of India.

detailsOfAchievement: i. Organic Farming Trainings: 124 families from 6 villages of North Sikkim and 99 families from 6 villages of Kalimpong trained on Organic Farming Practices with focus on seed saving, use of local indigenous seeds, green manure compost, vermi-compost, cattle manure management, crop rotation, mixed cropping, biological pest control and propagation of indigenous crops like millet, paddy, buckwheat, barley and cash crops like ginger and cardamom. 22 Cardamom Nurseries have been set up in North Sikkim. ii. Animal Husbandry with enhanced knowledge on Scientific Methods of Livestock Management: 96 youths from North Sikkim and 81 youths from Kalimpong trained and educated about practical knowledge on breeds, breeding techniques â€“ Artificial Insemination, balanced diet, water, dry fodder, green fodder along with on-hands and practical knowledge on diseases â€“ diagnosis and general treatment, castration and vaccination. iii. Crop Intensification and Mixed Cropping: 145 families from North Sikkim and 81 families from Kalimpong trained on Crop Intensification Techniques through Mixed Cropping and Square Meter Vegetable Garden. iv. Climate Change Resilient Crops: 22 Cardamom Nurseries have been set up in 10 villages of North Sikkim where climate change resilient varieties of cardamom in propagated and promoted. The decline of cardamom production in Mangan â€“ North Sikkim was negatively influencing the livelihood of the communities who mostly comprised of tribals. Anugyalaya started its intervention to revive the production of cardamom in the region in 2013 and at present more than 300 families are producing high yielding varieties of climate change resilient cardamom in the area. v. Bamboo Skills and Carpentry Workshops: Anugyalaya, so far has trained around 100 youths on bamboo skills, crafts and carpentry works through workshops in Kalimpong and Sikkim. The main concept behind conducting these trainings was to promote bamboo craftsmanship for better livelihood, use of locally available resources which are cost effective; to counter the effects of natural disasters like earthquake and landslides and over all promote integrated natural resource management by using bamboo components replacing reinforced concrete and steel. A Bamboo Training cum Processing Unit has been set up at Anugyalaya Farms at Pakang village of Kalimpong Block II under Kalimpong Sub-division of the District of Darjeeling, West Bengal â€“ India vi. Sensitization Program for the Youths on Forest, Wildlife Protection and Conservation Acts: Anugyalaya has also conducted various sensitization programs for the youths of Sikkim and Darjeeling on Forest, Wildlife Protection and Conservation Acts. 8 hoardings have been placed at different hotspots of 3 GPs of Kalimpong (Gitdubling, Nimbong and Lava-Gitbeong) to stop illegal hunting and fishing â€“ done in collaboration with the Department of Forest. vii. Community Health Center: Anugyalaya has set up and is running a community health center in Santook Mirik GP of Algarah, Kalimpong Block II with the help of the community members. The basic facilities taken care by the Health Center set up by Anugyalaya with the help of the PHC of Algarah are immunization and vaccination of children, diagnosis and treatment of simple ailments, basic maternal and child health care, geriatric care, periodic health camps and necessary referrals.

detailsOfAchievement: Nabadwip in Nadia, W.B needs no introduction. Besides being the holy birthplace of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, the apostle of unbounded love, peace and charity , this tiny town of one thousands plus year old legacy was once regarded as one of the most scared shrines of sanskritic learning. Birth place and home of hundreds of legendary scholar-teachers Nabadwip earned the sobriquet Oxford of Bengal in the British period.

detailsOfAchievement: A.Legal Awareness Programme organised with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women. Legal Awareness Programme was organised in Murshidabad District in West Bengal with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women in 2014-15. NCW provided a financial assistance of Rs. 200000. Organised at Venue: Talgram on 14th and 15th February 2015. The objective of the Legal Awareness Programme (LAP) was to empower women and girls with the knowledge of the laws related to women, legal rights and duties, to enable them, to share power equally, gain full access to the means of development, and to inspire a whole generation of women to work together towards achieving equality and justice. B. Food Packet Distribution to Widows with Donation from Orphans in Need. Food Packets were distributed to widows with donation from Orphans in Need. In the year 2014-15, Orphans in Need provided a donation of Rs. 210000 to Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. C. Mid Day Meal Expenditure. Mid Day Meal is provided at Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. Education facility is provided to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. An expenditure of Rs. 119300 was made on Mid Day Meal in 2014-15. D. Find Out Disabled Children Program Every year, we organise Disabled Children Programme. Through Community Survey, every year our organization finds 25 disabled children. We provide Education facility to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. Student assessments are implemented throughout the year to evaluate continued enrolment in this program.

detailsOfAchievement: This is a computer as well as soft skill training Institute. Nevertheless it has several motto. We mainly train computer hardware, software, Spoken English, Nursing training, Personality Development and so on. Apart from this we have a school for kids. We take special care for backward students. In this complicated and competitive society young generation getting hesitated and jobless due to lack of their skills on above mentioned matter. Therefore to make the young generation skillful we trying our level best to have many projects. Meanwhile we are going to have women skill Development programme such as tailoring, Hand craft, Embroidery and so on. Every year we arrange huge skill development programme, Seminars, Awareness camp. We also held many competitions on Drawing, Quiz Contest, Dance, Drama, Music, Recitation, Hand craft among the rural people. Our objective is not only to make the backwards but also all aged and categories people enriched, skillful and efficient. Not only that we also have several future plans. We want to serve on Medical awareness camp and programme on blood donation, AIDS, free eye test and so on. We also taking care of old aged persons. In this society they have no place, Young generation is about to forget the contribution of them. We personally are treating their problems, sufferings, troubles. Recently we conducted garbage cleaning operation with the help of young guys. Above all our service is the total development of the rural people in every corner of the interior. We want to offer a golden independent society on the palm of the government of India.
